trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login"></xref> Web-server control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control displays a user interface that allows a user to log on to the host Web site.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> class properties provide the following functionality:

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control and the top-level <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> template.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> class methods provide the following functionality:
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method returns a serialized copy of the template for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method provides the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> at design time when an error has occurred.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove properties from, add additional properties to, or shadow properties of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method sets a region of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> from a serialized copy of a control template.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets the designer action-list collection for this designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property creates a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> class, adds it to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object that is obtained from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.ActionLists%2A> base property, and then returns the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection>.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner"></xref> control allows resizing.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.RenderOuterTable%2A> property is set to `false`, the control does not allow resizing.
`true` if the control allows resizing; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the collection of predefined formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> object is populated from an XML-encoded member of an internal class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> that contains the predefined schemes for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login"></xref>.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method creates an <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LayoutTemplate%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control and adds it to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> object that is referenced by the `regions` parameter.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> base method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> to which definitions of the selectable and clickable regions in the design-time view of the control are added.
A string containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login"></xref> at design time.
Returns a serialized copy of the template that is used to render the associated control at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method creates a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LayoutTemplate%2A> object of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control in the control container and returns a serialized copy.

The serialized template can be restored to a part of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.
The `region` parameter is not used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> for which to fetch content.
A string containing a serialized copy of the template used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login"></xref> at design time.
Provides the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time when an error has occurred.
The placeholder that the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control renders contains the type name, the control name, and messages announcing and describing the error.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that was thrown.
A string that contains the markup used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login"></xref> at design time after an error has occurred.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

The visual designer calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.Initialize%2A> method and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login"></xref>, that implements an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>.
Used by the designer to remove properties from or add additional properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.

If a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LayoutTemplate%2A> property has been defined for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> attribute of properties that do not apply when templated to `false` so those properties do not appear in the **Properties** grid.
A collection implementing the <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> of the added and shadowed properties.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner"></xref> control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner> control uses an outer table container to apply inline style rule in the markup.
You can remove the outer table container by setting this property to `true`.
Removing the outer table gives you greater flexibility in how you apply CSS rules to the markup that is rendered by the control.
`true` if the control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Sets a region of the associated control from a serialized copy of a control template.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method parses a serialized template for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control that is specified by the `content` parameter, and then uses the template to update the region of the control that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerObject.Name%2A> property of the `region` parameter.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LayoutTemplate%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control can be serialized using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> that provides the name of the region to update.
A string that contains a serialized template for the associated control.
Gets a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property gets a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> base property, and then adds a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> object that contains a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> object for the layout template of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> to the caller.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection"></xref> containing an element for each templated field in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always `true`, the designer <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property returns a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control to generate the design-time markup.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property creates the copy by persisting the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control, then parsing the persisted control string.
The copied control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login>.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer uses the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.
Always `true`.
